show.title: Dogma
show.headline: Faith is a funny thing

event.title: <show-title>Dogma</show-title> <event-type-title>Resurrected! 25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: New 4K remaster including exclusive bonus content
event.description: DOGMA is a satirical fantasy comedy that follows two fallen angels, Bartleby and Loki, who discover a loophole that would allow them to return to Heaven, which would inadvertently undo the creation of the universe. A woman named Bethany, who is struggling with her faith, is tasked with stopping them before their plan succeeds. Along the way, she is joined by various characters, including a muse, a seraphim, and a group of unlikely allies, all as they battle against the forces of heaven and hell. Directed by Kevin Smith, the film combines dark humor, theological questions, and absurdity to explore topics of faith, redemption, and religious mythology. After 25 years off the market, DOGMA serves to be a cult classic with fans, and this new 4K remaster also includes exclusive bonus content only available in theatres.

show.title: How To Train Your Dragon (2025)
show.headline: A live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise

event.title: <show-title>How To Train Your Dragon (2025)</show-title> <event-type-title>3D Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: Be among the first to see this live-action reimagining in 3D
event.description:
From three-time Oscar® nominee and Golden Globe winner Dean DeBlois, the creative visionary behind DreamWorks Animation’s acclaimed HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON trilogy, comes a stunning live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise.

On the rugged isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been bitter enemies for generations, Hiccup (Mason Thames; THE BLACK PHONE, For All Mankind) stands apart. The inventive yet overlooked son of Chief Stoick the Vast (Gerard Butler, reprising his voice role from the animated franchise), Hiccup defies centuries of tradition when he befriends Toothless, a feared Night Fury dragon. Their unlikely bond reveals the true nature of dragons, challenging the very foundations of Viking society. With the fierce and ambitious Astrid (BAFTA nominee Nico Parker; DUMBO, The Last of Us) and the village’s quirky blacksmith Gobber (Nick Frost; SNOW WHITE AND THE HUNTSMAN, SHAUN OF THE DEAD) by his side, Hiccup confronts a world torn by fear and misunderstanding. As an ancient threat emerges, endangering both Vikings and dragons, Hiccup’s friendship with Toothless becomes the key to forging a new future. Together, they must navigate the delicate path toward peace, soaring beyond the boundaries of their worlds and redefining what it means to be a hero and a leader.

eventType.title: Advance Screening
eventType.headline: Be the first to see your new favorite film.
eventType.description: We work with studios, distributors, and filmmaker pals to give our guests a sneak peek at what’s coming down the line.

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

show.title: Ron Delsener Presents
show.headline: Meet the godfather of gigs who helped transform the live music business

event.title: <show-title>Ron Delsener Presents</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Intro</event-type-title>
event.headline: Executive Producer     Todd Stiefel Live in Person
event.description:
Live intro with executive producer Todd Stiefel

In a career spanning 60 years, concert promoter and impresario Ron Delsener was the name behind virtually every major contemporary music concert in New York City for generations. From promoting The Beatles at Forest Hills Tennis Stadium to bringing David Bowie to Carnegie Hall and Patti Smith to the Palladium to somehow convincing Simon and Garfunkel to bury the hatchet and play the biggest concert of all time in Central Park, Ron Delsener was behind it all.

Through a portrait of a mercurial and relentless showman, RON DELSENER PRESENTS takes us behind the curtain through the last half-century of the live music business, chronicling the tactics that drove live performance from disorganized, low-fi nightclubs to international tours, arenas, stadiums, and eventually, into a global empire – a transformation that Delsener is in many ways responsible for. Working in a business he helped to create, Ron Delsener, now in the later stages of his life, still has his hand in the game. Sure, he could stop – he maybe even should – but Ron doesn’t know how.

eventType.title: Live Intro
eventType.headline: Essential context straight from the source
eventType.description: What better way is there to understand a film to have it prefaced by the artist who made it? At our Live Intro screenings, we invite filmmakers and talent to stop by before a film to provide something we could all use a little more of – perspective.

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring shark hats, yellow floatie drink holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and a boat-shaped bath bomb with a great white shark in the center, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

imageAsset.title: Jaws Marthas Vineyard Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

image.altText: Jaws Marthas Vineyard Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
We’re kicking off a summer-long JAWS celebration in the most fitting of locations – the original Amity Island shooting location, Martha’s Vineyard. Fans of the movie (and who isn’t?) are invited for an unforgettable experience on June 21 at JAWS in Concert, presented by the Martha’s Vineyard Chamber of Commerce, as part of the Alamo Drafthouse Rolling Roadshow tour.

  • Saturday, June 21
  • Winnetu Oceanside Resort
  • JAWS Screening accompanied by live score with Cape Cod Symphony
  • Commemorative blanket and tote bag included with all tickets
  • Bigger Boat VIP experience includes reserved seating, exclusive swag bag with special treats from Discovery Shark Week, Universal Pictures, and more, classic New England fare, including lobster rolls, a raw bar, craft cocktails and open bar. 21+

Reserve your spot here.

imageAsset.title: Jaws On The Water Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080 1

image.altText: Jaws On The Water Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080 1

contentBlocks.paragraphs: For those in Texas, Rolling Roadshow is bringing back the summer event that made CNN ask, “Could there possibly be any scarier way to watch JAWS?" JAWS on the Water, sponsored by the Texas Lottery, is an immersive screening experience you won't soon forget. A huge inflatable outdoor screen is placed at the water’s edge at Volente Beach Resort and Waterpark in Austin with intrepid viewers watching the movie while floating in custom inner tubes. As everyone watches Chief Brody and crew on the hunt for the Great White, floaters might feel something tug on their toes as scuba divers provide an added thrill to the proceedings. The evening concludes with an explosive finale. Get tickets starting at $35 for June 7th, June 21st, July 12th, or July 26th.

image.altText: JAWS x Alamo Drafthouse merch collection on AlamoMart.com

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Dive into the deep with our exclusive JAWS merchandise! From jaw-dropping apparel to collectible memorabilia, the JAWS x Alamo Drafthouse collection is perfect for every fan of the classic Spielberg thriller. Whether you're hunting for beach-ready tees or shark-inspired accessories, we've got everything you need to show your love for the great white legend. You’re gonna need a bigger shopping cart.

show.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
show.headline: Bigger. Bolder. Blonder.

event.title: <show-title>Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bigger. Bolder. Blonder.
event.description:
Now a rising young lawyer, Elle Woods is about to make partner at her firm, but when she finds out her dog's relatives are being used as cosmetic test subjects, she heads to Washington, D.C. to fight for animal rights.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Hot dog keychain - It looks like the Fourth of July.
  • Pet bandana - Don't forget, your dog's accessories are just as important as yours.
  • Gay dog sticker - Love is love.
  • Snap cup set - Decorate your own Snap cup and always celebrate your little wins.

show.title: Midsommar
show.headline: An unsettling celebration from the director of HEREDITARY

event.title: <show-title>Midsommar</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: An unsettling celebration from the director of HEREDITARY
event.description:
“It digs into emotions that are just as real and deeply uncomfortable as the ones shared between the characters in the earlier picture. I can also tell you that there are true visions in this picture, particularly in the final stretch, that you are not likely to forget. I certainly haven’t.” – Martin Scorsese

Director Ari Aster’s trippy and tense follow-up to his nightmarish debut, HEREDITARY, brightens the exteriors but retains an uneasy menace in this wild dive into what he calls “Scandinavian folk horror.” Florence Pugh – in a breakout role – and Jack Reynor star as Dani and Christian, a young couple going through a rough patch, with a vacation in a tiny sun-dappled Swedish village seeming to be exactly what they need to heal.

They arrive during a nine-day pagan festival filled with flower garlands, kinship, and twirling 'round the maypole. But on closer look (and under the influence of mysterious powders), they find a bizarre undercurrent of cultish violence beneath the smiling facade…

With all manner of grief, confusion, and ritualistic sadism unfolding in the radiant light of day, MIDSOMMAR will forever change the way you look at the idyllic countryside. Remember to breathe.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Flower crown: The perfect accessory to celebrate the summer solstice.
  • Tea bag: Don't worry, no hallucinogens in this tea. Just the delicious blend of green tea, rose, and jasmine.
  • Bear keychain: Let this be the focus of all your rage and then let it live inside your origami temple.
  • Yellow origami temple: Wait until you get home to set this one on fire.

Director Ari Aster’s trippy and tense follow-up to his nightmarish debut, HEREDITARY, brightens the exteriors but retains an uneasy menace in this wild dive into what he calls “Scandinavian folk horror.” Florence Pugh – in a breakout role – and Jack Reynor star as Dani and Christian, a young couple going through a rough patch, with a vacation in a tiny sun-dappled Swedish village seeming to be exactly what they need to heal.

They arrive during a nine-day pagan festival filled with flower garlands, kinship, and twirling 'round the maypole. But on closer look (and under the influence of mysterious powders), they find a bizarre undercurrent of cultish violence beneath the smiling facade…

With all manner of grief, confusion, and ritualistic sadism unfolding in the radiant light of day, MIDSOMMAR will forever change the way you look at the idyllic countryside. Remember to breathe.

imageAsset.title: Midsommar Promos Film Title Movie Party Prop Promo Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Flower crown: The perfect accessory to celebrate the summer solstice.
  • Tea bag: Don't worry, no hallucinogens in this tea. Just the delicious blend of green tea, rose, and jasmine.
  • Bear keychain: Let this be the focus of all your rage and then let it live inside your origami temple.
  • Yellow origami temple: Wait until you get home to set this one on fire.

show.title: When Harry Met Sally...
show.headline: Ring in the new year with the timeless rom-com

event.title: <show-title>When Harry Met Sally...</show-title>
event.headline: Celine Song shares the films that inspired MATERIALISTS
event.description:
WHEN HARRY MET SALLY... is presented as part of our Celine Song Guest Selects for influencing her new film, MATERIALISTS. See an exclusive sneak peek of MATERIALISTS at this screening.

"WHEN HARRY MET SALLY... and YOU'VE GOT MAIL are two quintessential New York love stories, both written by Nora Ephron. I love these films because they are both committed to two seemingly conflicting truths about love: on one level, we can’t choose to fall in love – it just happens – and on another level, love and romance can’t be separated from our material reality. What better city to explore that dialectic than New York? NYC is a city full of hopeless romantics and bitter realists – and to survive here, you often have to be both at the same time. These films understand that so intimately, epically, and beautifully. – Celine Song

show.title: Knife + Heart
show.headline: The queer neo-giallo of your dreams

show.title: Showgirls
show.headline: Paul Verhoeven's high glam & camp satire

event.title: <show-title>Showgirls</show-title>
event.headline: Paul Verhoeven’s dubiously erotic expedition into Las Vegas’ heart of darkness
event.description:
“THRUST IT! THRUST IT!”

This is a big one, folks! We’ve been talking about screening SHOWGIRLS since the beginning of Queer Film Theory 101 and we’re so jazzed to start our summer series with this controversial cult classic from director Paul Verhoeven.

Released 30 years ago to much criticism and confusion, SHOWGIRLS follows cagey outsider, Nomi Malone (Elizabeth Berkley) as she enters the sleazy and sinister world of Las Vegas topless dance revues. On her journey, Nomi encounters Cristal Conners (Gina Gershon), the current reigning queen of Las Vegas nightlife, and her shmarmy boyfriend, casino promoter Zach Carey (Kyle MacLachlan). Will Nomi become a star with the help of her ridiculously supportive best friend Molly (Gina Rivera), or will she descend into the neon inferno never to return? Overflowing with quotable dialogue and bizarre character choices, tonally erratic and often nonsensical, SHOWGIRLS is a truly unique blend of ALL ABOUT EVE, A STAR IS BORN, and after-hours Cinemax softcore porn. Is it sexy? Who cares, it’s pretty damn queer! (It’s also a stealth vampire film – don’t argue with me, I’ll explain in the intro.) So slip on your favorite “Versayce,” pour yourself a big bowl of doggy chow, and get ready to dance like a swarm of bees is attacking you as we dive into the most famous NC-17 rated film of all time – SHOWGIRLS! Remember, darlin', there's always someone younger and hungrier coming down the stairs after you.

show.title: Stand By Me
show.headline: See another side of Stephen King with this tender classic

show.title: Carnival of Souls
show.headline: The ground-breaking surrealist chiller

event.title: <show-title>Carnival of Souls</show-title>
event.headline: The ground-breaking surrealist chiller
event.description:
Very few regional horror movies are strong enough to be considered miracles. But CARNIVAL OF SOULS is a miracle beyond miracles. After a mysterious car accident, Mary (Candace Hilligoss) takes a job as a church organist. Subsequently, she finds herself tormented by a mysterious ghoul...and his undead friends. Shot in Lawrence, Kansas, and at Utah's majestic Saltair Pavilion by industrial filmmaker Herk Harvey, CARNIVAL OF SOULS is like nothing else on the planet. With its stunning black and white photography and ghostly organ score, this eerie, thoughtful dreamscape influenced everything from George Romero’s NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD to David Lynch’s ERASERHEAD. Prepare to have your skeleton rattled. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

DCP courtesy of Janus Films

show.title: The People Under the Stairs
show.headline: Wes Craven’s unsung classic

portraitHeroImage.altText: People under the stairs sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Showpage Poster People Under The Stairs

event.title: <show-title>The People Under the Stairs</show-title>
event.headline: Wes Craven's unsung classic
event.description: With LAST HOUSE ON THE LEFT, A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET, and SCREAM, the late Wes Craven revolutionized the horror genre on three separate occasions over three separate decades. But with THE PEOPLE UNDER THE STAIRS, Craven unleashed the most forward-thinking work of his career – a horror movie about the horrors of classism. Featuring incredible performances from Wendy Robie and Everett McGill (aka Ed and Nadine from Twin Peaks) and Ving Rhames (PULP FICTION), this nerve-shredding masterwork explodes with vicious violence, sick humor, and a heroic scene of a kid punching a rich scumbag in the crotch.

show.title: The Return of the Living Dead
show.headline: The essential zombie splatter-massacre

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD

posterImages.altText: Showpage Poster Return Of The Living Dead

event.title: <show-title>The Return of the Living Dead</show-title>
event.headline: The essential zombie splatter-massacre.
event.description:
In the battle between punks and zombies, everyone wins. Originally conceived as a sequel to George Romero's NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD, RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD follows teen punker Fred (Thom Mathews, FRIDAY THE 13TH PART VI: JASON LIVES) as he accidentally opens a barrel of toxic waste and unleashes an army of undead wasteoids. Featuring a fist-pumping punk ‘n’ metal soundtrack, incredible gore effects, and an iconic role from Linnea Quigley as a spazzoid named “Trash,” this is a truly unmissable shockwave of zombie rampaging and mohawked rage. More BRAIIIIINS!

Screening from an archival 35mm print.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Vourdalak
show.headline: Take a bite outta life!

event.title: <show-title>The Vourdalak</show-title>
event.headline: Take a bite outta life!
event.description:
Presented in French with English subtitles

When the Marquis d’Urfé, a noble emissary of the King of France, is attacked and abandoned in the remote countryside, he finds refuge at an eerie, isolated manor. The resident family, reluctant to take him in, exhibits strange behavior as they await the imminent return of their father, Gorcha. But what begins simply as strange quickly devolves into a full fledged nightmare when Gorcha returns, seemingly no longer himself…

Adapted from a novella that predates Bram Stoker’s Dracula by over half a century, THE VOURDALAK is an atmospheric, unexpected, sensorial experience that will leave you reeling and giddy in equal measure.

DCP courtesy of Oscilloscope Laboratories

show.title: Unfriended: Dark Web
show.headline: Step into the terrifying online world of the dark web.

event.title: <show-title>Unfriended: Dark Web</show-title>
event.headline: Step into the terrifying online world of the dark web.
event.description:
Miles better than it has any right being - Stephen Susco crafted a follow-up to the semi-hit UNFRIENDED but improved on it in a major way, creating one of the most ingenious horror films of our times. Preceding the likes of Harmony Korine's BABY INVASION by about 7 years, Susco tells his entire film through the computer screen, the digital apparatus that has taken over the modern era. As friends gather to play games online, one of them mistakenly has stolen his new laptop from a stranger, and is now realizing how big of a mistake he has made. Suddenly, shadowy figures have figured out where their mysterious laptop is, and will stop at nothing to get it back. Pitch-black terror wrapped in formal invention, this movie deserves a much bigger following. (John Dickson)

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Crank: High Voltage
show.headline: Jason Statham is back to shock you (literally)

event.title: <show-title>Crank: High Voltage</show-title>
event.headline: Jason Statham is back to shock you (literally)
event.description:
It seemed nearly impossible for writer/director duo Mark Neveldine/Brian Taylor to top the ridiculous antics of their 2006 sleeper hit CRANK, and yet they did just that. Picking up right where the original left off, CRANK: HIGH VOLTAGE sees everyone's favorite hitman, Chev Chelios (Jason Statham), swap out his adrenaline-dependent poison for an artificial heart with a constantly draining battery. Neveldine/Taylor find a plethora of laughably absurd ways for Chev to keep his heart charged. From your standard jumper cables to some very rough public sex at a racetrack, CRANK: HIGH VOLTAGE is sure to keep your adrenaline pumping all the way to the final bloody frame. (Trace Thurman)

DCP courtesy of Lionsgate

show.title: School in the Crosshairs
show.headline: An anti-fascist manga explosion from the director of HAUSU

event.title: <show-title>School in the Crosshairs</show-title>
event.headline: An anti-fascist manga explosion from the director of HAUSU
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

This early "idol" movie by genre master Nobuhiko Obayashi (HOUSE) stars Hiroko Yakushimaru, then the heart-throb of millions of Japanese fans. Yuko (Yakushimaru) is a high school girl with telekinetic powers who must defend her school from an extraterrestrial attack. A new student is using her own psychic abilities to transform the school into a fascistic staging area for an alien takeover of the Earth. Offering powerful political commentary with plenty of sci-fi thrills, SCHOOL IN THE CROSSHAIRS is a stylish crowd-pleaser from one of Japan’s most electric auteurs.

DCP courtesy of Cult Epics and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: The Apple
show.headline: Bim's on the way and you don't want to miss him.

event.title: <show-title>The Apple</show-title>
event.headline: Bim's on the way and you don't want to miss him.
event.description:
Thoroughly rogueish futuristic disco musical/religious allegory from Cannon Films. There’s never been a movie even remotely like this and I wouldn’t bet on one being made in the future. A young couple, Bibi and Alphie from Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan come to the big city to make it big in show business only to fall into the clutches of the satanic Mr. Boogolow, who runs a giant music conglomorate called Boogolow International Music (BIM) that’s roughly as powerful as the Military-Industrial Complex. Bibi becomes a star and takes Satan’s drugs but eventually Alphie musters the forces of Jesus to defeat BIM and take all the true believers and white children to Heaven in a Rolls Royce. With huge, shiny musical numbers that you won’t believe you’re seeing, including one in Hell, with dog-headed musclemen and vampires dancing around Satan’s throne. Non-missable.

DCP courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: The Mystery of Chess Boxing
show.headline: Some say that the game of chess is like a sword fight

event.title: <show-title>The Mystery of Chess Boxing</show-title>
event.headline: Some say that the game of chess is like a sword fight
event.description:
The original Ghostface Killer is on the loose! A vicious villain with an unstoppable five element technique, Ghostface is killing off all his old rivals. Meanwhile, a young student tries to learn kung fu and is taken under the wing of an old chess master. The basics of chess prove to be the same as the basics of fighting, and eventually the heroes will have to fight Ghostface Killer, who verbally insults his opponents as he annihilates them. A true classic, and obvious favorite of the Wu Tang Clan, directed by Joseph Kuo (SEVEN GRANDMASTERS). (Hollywood Theatre)

A brand new DCP of the 1979 old school kung fu classic, sourced from the only known 35mm print!

show.title: The Timekeepers of Eternity
show.headline: A TV movie adaptation of a Stephen King story undergoes a deeper transformation

landscapeHeroImage.altText: The timekeepers of eternity sp still

event.title: <show-title>The Timekeepers of Eternity</show-title>
event.headline: An unbelievable recut of THE LANGOLIERS that must be seen to be believed.
event.description:
"A really remarkable feat . . . such a delightful superceding of the source material that it feels like it should be considered the primary text."

—Zane Gordon-Bouzard, LETTERBOXD

Welcome to your new favorite Stephen King adaptation. A found footage appropriation from filmmaker Aristotelis Maragkos, THE TIMEKEEPERS OF ETERNITY was meticulously crafted by creating a new edit of King's TV mini-series THE LANGOLIERS, printing each frame to paper, then animating it all into a brand new creature feature. But there's a method to the madness. In THE LANGOLIERS, Mr. Toomey (played by an unhinged Bronson Pinchot) obsessively tears paper to overcome the traumatic events—and literal monsters—of his childhood. In TIMEKEEPERS, the tears and creases of photocopied paper transform into a living collage where the filmmaker and protagonist slowly merge with a common goal: to make sense of the paper nightmare.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive

show.headline: Francis falls into a scheme to preserve absolute male domination

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
